constant.Name: IMAGE_CACHE_THRESHOLD
constant.Comment: Threshold for image cache storage

constant.Name: PORTING_NO_FILESYSTEM
constant.Comment: Whether your platform supports File System. Set to true when File System is not supported; set to false when File System is supported.

constant.Name: CHAM_USE_IMAGES
constant.Comment: When false, Chameleon will not even attempt to load images for the UI.

constant.Name: CHAM_ROMIZED_IMAGES
constant.Comment: When false, Chameleon will not even attempt to load romized images for the UI.

constant.Name: CHAM_WIDTH
constant.Comment: (Chameleon Only) display width

constant.Name: CHAM_FULLWIDTH
constant.Comment: (Chameleon Only) full display width

constant.Name: CHAM_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: (Chameleon Only) display height

constant.Name: CHAM_FULLHEIGHT
constant.Comment: (Chameleon Only) full display height

constant.Name: TRAVERSAL2D
constant.Comment: (Chameleon Only) 2-D Traversal flag

constant.Name: MAX_EVENTS
constant.Comment: The maximum number of events in the event queue

constant.Name: FULLWIDTH
constant.Comment: (Fixed) full display width

constant.Name: FULLHEIGHT
constant.Comment: (Fixed) full display height

constant.Name: NORMALWIDTH
constant.Comment: (Fixed) normal width

constant.Name: NORMALHEIGHT
constant.Comment: (Fixed) normal height

constant.Name: VERT_SCROLLBAR_WIDTH
constant.Comment: the width of the vertical scrollbar

constant.Name: ERASE_COLOR
constant.Comment: Color, in hex, to use as the erase color (the color used to clear away any existing pixels from a graphics object before painting the new pixels).

constant.Name: SCROLLS_HORIZONTAL
constant.Comment: Whether the viewport is capable of scrolling horizontally

constant.Name: SCROLLS_VERTICAL
constant.Comment: Whether the viewport is capable of scrolling vertically

constant.Name: DISPLAY_DEPTH
constant.Comment: Color depth the platform supports, in bits per pixel (bpp).

constant.Name: IMAGE_DEPTH
constant.Comment: Depth of the platform image (in bits). @note This is the bit depth of an image and it may not be the same as the bit depth of the entire system.

constant.Name: DISPLAY_IS_COLOR
constant.Comment: Whether the platform supports color: set it to true when color is supported; set it to false when color is not supported.

constant.Name: DISPLAY_NUM_COLOR
constant.Comment: Number of color the platform supports

constant.Name: ALPHA_LEVELS
constant.Comment: Number of alpha channel levels the platform supports

constant.Name: IS_DOUBLE_BUFFERED
constant.Comment: Whether the platform and MIDP implementation supports double-buffering: set to true when double-buffering is supported; set to false when double-buffering is not supported.

constant.Name: KEYCODE_UP
constant.Comment: key up code (internal)

constant.Name: KEYCODE_DOWN
constant.Comment: key down code (internal)

constant.Name: KEYCODE_LEFT
constant.Comment: key left code (internal)

constant.Name: KEYCODE_RIGHT
constant.Comment: key right code (internal)

constant.Name: KEYCODE_SELECT
constant.Comment: key select code (internal)

constant.Name: MEASURE_STARTUP
constant.Comment: Turn on/off startup time measurement printouts.

constant.Name: JAVA_HEAP_CAPACITY_SVM
constant.Comment: Java heap capacity in SVM mode

constant.Name: JAVA_HEAP_CAPACITY_MVM
constant.Comment: Java heap capacity in MVM mode

constant.Name: STORAGE_SUITE_LIMIT
constant.Comment: Per suite resource limit for storage

constant.Name: RMS_CACHE_LIMIT
constant.Comment: Global memory limit (in Bytes) for RMS caching

property.Comment: Select the low level transport handler.
The datagram host name.
The datagram port number for inbound messages from the SMS emulator.
The datagram port number of a SMS emulator.
Amount of space to reserve for JAM storage.
Create a CBS message connection protocol port number
The phone number for outbound messages from the SMS emulator.
Default SMS Service Center address.
Path separator.

constant.Name: POINTER_SUPPORTED
constant.Comment: Whether both the platform and MIDP implementation provide support for a pointer (press and release). Set to true when pointer is supported; set to false when pointer is not supported.

constant.Name: MOTION_SUPPORTED
constant.Comment: If your platform supports pointer motion and you want MIDP implementation provides support for pointer motions, set it to true; otherwise, set it to false so that MIDP runtime can provide this information to MIDlet.

constant.Name: REPEAT_SUPPORTED
constant.Comment: If your platform support key repeat and you want MIDP implementation provides support for key repeat, set this to true, otherwise set it to false.

constant.Name: REPEAT_TIMEOUT
constant.Comment: If your platform support key repeat and you want MIDP implementation needs to support key repeat, set this to value of timeout before repeat key event generation.

constant.Name: REPEAT_PERIOD
constant.Comment: If your platform support key repeat and you want MIDP implementation needs to support key repeat, set this to value of period between next repeat key event generation.

constant.Name: LOG_CURRENT
constant.Comment: A value indicating that there is no need to change the current logging level.

constant.Name: LOG_INFORMATION
constant.Comment: Logging level used to report information that is not associated with any significant condition.

constant.Name: LOG_WARNING
constant.Comment: Logging level used to report unexpected conditions that are typically fully recoverable.

constant.Name: LOG_ERROR
constant.Comment: Logging level used to report unexpected conditions that are typically at least partially recoverable.

constant.Name: LOG_CRITICAL
constant.Comment: Logging level used to report unexpected conditions that are typically not recoverable, or are catastrophic to the system.

constant.Name: LOG_DISABLED
constant.Comment: Logging level used to disable all output and all logging calls will be compiled out of the build.

constant.Name: REPORT_LEVEL
constant.Comment: Threshhold for the severity level below which log messages will not be recorded. Severity levels less than this value can be compiled out of the build.

constant.Name: TRACE_ENABLED
constant.Comment: Flag to indicate whether tracing is enabled in the Logging service.

constant.Name: ASSERT_ENABLED
constant.Comment: Flag allowing client code with assert statements to be compiled out of a production build.

constant.Name: AMS_MEMORY_RESERVED_MVM
constant.Comment: Default AMS memory reserved in MVM mode

constant.Name: AMS_MEMORY_LIMIT_MVM
constant.Comment: Default AMS memory limit in MVM mode

constant.Name: MIDLET_CONSTRUCTOR_FAILED
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when a MIDlet's constructor fails to catch a runtime exception

constant.Name: MIDLET_SUITE_NOT_FOUND
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when a MIDlet suite is not found

constant.Name: MIDLET_CLASS_NOT_FOUND
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when a class needed to create a MIDlet is not found.

constant.Name: MIDLET_INSTANTIATION_EXCEPTION
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when intantiation exception is thrown during the intantiation of a MIDlet.

constant.Name: MIDLET_ILLEGAL_ACCESS_EXCEPTION
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when illegal access exception is thrown during the intantiation of a MIDlet.

constant.Name: MIDLET_OUT_OF_MEM_ERROR
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when a MIDlet's constructor runs out of memory.

constant.Name: MIDLET_RESOURCE_LIMIT
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when a the system cannot reserve enough resource to start a MIDlet suite.

constant.Name: MIDLET_ISOLATE_CONSTRUCTOR_FAILED
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when a MIDlet's isolate constructor throws to catch a runtime exception

constant.Name: MIDLET_ID_NOT_GIVEN
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when a MIDlet's ID is not given

constant.Name: MIDLET_CLASS_NOT_GIVEN
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when a MIDlet's class is not given

constant.Name: MIDLET_SUITE_DISABLED
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when a MIDlet's suite is disabled

constant.Name: MIDLET_ISOLATE_RESOURCE_LIMIT
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when system has exceeded the maximum Isolate count.

constant.Name: MIDLET_INSTALLER_RUNNING
constant.Comment: MIDlet start error status, when that MIDlet is being updated.

constant.Name: MIDLET_APPID_NO_FOREGROUND
constant.Comment: Reserved external application id for setting no MIDlet in foreground

constant.Name: MAX_INSTALL_DELETE_NOTIFICATION_RETRIES
constant.Comment: Number of times an install or delete notification has to be retried by the notification manager. Check the specification for the minimal allowed value.

constant.Name: MINIMUM_FLUSH_INTERVAL
constant.Comment: The period in milliseconds after the first call to GameCanvas.flush() when any subsequent call to the method will be ignored. This is the performance optimization limiting too frequent calls to GameCanvas.flush(). 40 seems to be the optimum value. Be careful to enable the optimization as it may lead to the MIDP spec violation in some cases. The value set 0 disables the optimization.

constant.Name: DELAYED_FLUSH_PERIOD
constant.Comment: The period in milliseconds of processing the last delayed call to GameCanvas.flush().

constant.Name: RECORD_STORE_NOTIFICATION_QUEUE_SIZE
constant.Comment: Maximal number of notifications about record store changes that can be placed into event queue of VM task.

constant.Name: RECORD_STORE_NOTIFICATION_TIMEOUT
constant.Comment: Allowed time in milliseconds to block record store changer until its notifications are acknowledged by receiver VM task.

constant.Name: RECORD_STORE_NOTIFICATION_ATTEMPTS
constant.Comment: Number of attempts to send notification event about record store change in the case there is receiver VM task that cannot accept the event.

constant.Name: MIDP_NO_DEBUG
constant.Comment: No debug.

constant.Name: MIDP_DEBUG_SUSPEND
constant.Comment: Debug: suspend the VM until the debugger sends a continue command.

constant.Name: MIDP_DEBUG_NO_SUSPEND
constant.Comment: Debug: do not wait for the debugger.
