constant.Name: SCREEN_TEXT_ORIENT
constant.Comment: The orientation of text. The value indicates the directionality of various text on the display. Valid values are Graphics.LEFT and Graphics.RIGHT. A value of Graphics.RIGHT, for example, would indicate text which reads from left to right. NOTE: This property currently has no effect.

constant.Name: SCREEN_PAD_FORM_ITEMS
constant.Comment: The amount of padding (in pixels) between items in a Form.

constant.Name: SCREEN_PAD_LABEL_VERT
constant.Comment: The amount of padding (in pixels) around the top/bottom of a label.

constant.Name: SCREEN_PAD_LABEL_HORIZ
constant.Comment: The amount of padding (in pixels) around the left/right of a label.

constant.Name: SCREEN_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The background color for a screen. In cases where there is either no image background or the images could not be loaded, this color is used as a solid fill for screen backgrounds.

constant.Name: SCREEN_COLOR_HS_BG
constant.Comment: The background color for the 'home' screen. In cases where there no image background or the images could not be loaded, this color is used as a solid fill for screen backgrounds.

constant.Name: SCREEN_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground color for a screen. This is the basic color that all foreground text is painted.

constant.Name: SCREEN_COLOR_BG_HL
constant.Comment: The background highlight color for highlighted elements. This is often the solid background color for selected text and things of that nature.

constant.Name: SCREEN_COLOR_FG_HL
constant.Comment: The foreground highlight color for highlighted elements. This is often the foreground color for selected text and things of that nature. It should be of a contrasting nature to the background highlight color.

constant.Name: SCREEN_COLOR_BORDER
constant.Comment: The color to use for a border around a custom item.

constant.Name: SCREEN_COLOR_BORDER_HL
constant.Comment: The color to use for a border around a custom item which is currently traversed to (or highlighted).

constant.Name: SCREEN_COLOR_TRAVERSE_IND
constant.Comment: The color with which to draw a traversal indicator for elements which must do so (such as custom items).

constant.Name: SCREEN_BORDER_STYLE
constant.Comment: The style of border for those visual elements which draw a border, either Graphics.SOLID or Graphics.DOTTED.

constant.Name: SCREEN_SCROLL_AMOUNT
constant.Comment: The amount of pixels to scroll the contents of the Screen at one time.

constant.Name: SCREEN_FONT_LABEL
constant.Comment: The Font to use when rendering Item labels in a Form.

constant.Name: SCREEN_FONT_INPUT_TEXT
constant.Comment: The Font to use as the predefined Font.INPUT_TEXT font.

constant.Name: SCREEN_FONT_STATIC_TEXT
constant.Comment: The Font to use as the predefined Font.STATIC_TEXT font.

constant.Name: SCREEN_IMAGE_WASH
constant.Comment: The Image to use as a tile to paint a 'wash' over the rest of the screen contents. An example of this is when displaying an Alert on top of other screen elements, the background is covered with a semi-transparent 'wash' to give it a grayish-out effect. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, no wash will be painted.

constant.Name: SCREEN_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: The Image to use as a tile for the typical screen background. This image could be either fullsize, or if smaller than fullsize, it will be tiled both horizontally and vertically to fill the entire screen background.

constant.Name: SCREEN_IMAGE_BG_W_TITLE
constant.Comment: The 9 pc Image background to use for the typical screen background with a title. The images correspond to: Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. The top-bar is the area which serves to visually cap the top of the background. The middle-bar is the background 'tile' for a single horizontal row of the background. It will be repeatedly drawn vertically to fill the background area between the top-bar and the bottom-bar. The bottom-bar is the bottom border of the screen background and serves to visually cap the bottom of the background. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the background, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: SCREEN_IMAGE_BG_WO_TITLE
constant.Comment: The 9 pc Image background to use for the typical screen background without a title. The images correspond to: Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. The top-bar is the area which serves to visually cap the top of the background. The middle-bar is the background 'tile' for a single horizontal row of the background. It will be repeatedly drawn vertically to fill the background area between the top-bar and the bottom-bar. The bottom-bar is the bottom border of the screen background and serves to visually cap the bottom of the background. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the background, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: SCREEN_IMAGE_HS_BG_TILE
constant.Comment: The Image to use as a tile for the 'home' screen background. This image could be either fullsize, or if smaller than fullsize, it will be tiled both horizontally and vertically to fill the entire screen background.

constant.Name: SCREEN_IMAGE_HS_BG_W_TITLE
constant.Comment: The 9 pc Image background to use for the 'home' screen background with a title. The images correspond to: Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. The top-bar is the area which serves to visually cap the top of the background. The middle-bar is the background 'tile' for a single horizontal row of the background. It will be repeatedly drawn vertically to fill the background area between the top-bar and the bottom-bar. The bottom-bar is the bottom border of the screen background and serves to visually cap the bottom of the background. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the background, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: SCREEN_IMAGE_HS_BG_WO_TITLE
constant.Comment: The 9 pc Image background to use for the 'home' screen background without a title. The images correspond to: Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. The top-bar is the area which serves to visually cap the top of the background. The middle-bar is the background 'tile' for a single horizontal row of the background. It will be repeatedly drawn vertically to fill the background area between the top-bar and the bottom-bar. The bottom-bar is the bottom border of the screen background and serves to visually cap the bottom of the background. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the background, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified pr cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: SCROLL_MODE
constant.Comment: The 'mode' of the scroll indicator. Valid values are either ScrollIndSkin.MODE_ARROWS or ScrollIndSkin.MODE_BAR.

constant.Name: SCROLL_WIDTH
constant.Comment: The width of the scroll indicator. This value is only used when no images can be loaded to determine the indicator's width.

constant.Name: SCROLL_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The background fill color for the scroll indicator (in bar mode). If no images can be loaded, this color is used to render the background of a scrollbar.

constant.Name: SCROLL_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground fill color for the scroll indicator (in bar mode). If no images can be loaded, this color is used to render the foreground of a scrollbar.

constant.Name: SCROLL_COLOR_FRAME
constant.Comment: The foreground fill color for the scroll bar frame.

constant.Name: SCROLL_COLOR_UP_ARROW
constant.Comment: The foreground fill color for the pressed scrollbar arrow

constant.Name: SCROLL_COLOR_DN_ARROW
constant.Comment: The foreground fill color for the released scrollbar arrow

constant.Name: SCROLL_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: A 3 piece background image to use to render the background of the scroll indicator (in bar mode). Piece 0: Top cap of the bar. Piece 1: Middle tile of the bar. Piece 2: Bottom cap of the bar. These images are used to render a background for the scrollbar. If the combined heights of the top, middle, and bottom images is less than the overall height of the scrollbar, the middle image will be tiled vertically to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: SCROLL_IMAGE_FG
constant.Comment: A 3 piece foreground image to use to render the 'thumb' of the scroll indicator (in bar mode). Piece 0: Top cap of the thumb. Piece 1: Middle tile of the thumb. Piece 2: Bottom cap of the thumb. These images are used to render a foreground for the scrollbar. If the combined heights of the top, middle, and bottom images is less than the overall height of the thumb, the middle image will be tiled vertically to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of foreground image.

constant.Name: SCROLL_IMAGE_UP
constant.Comment: The 'up' arrow for a scroll indicator in arrow mode.

constant.Name: SCROLL_IMAGE_DN
constant.Comment: The 'down' arrow for a scroll indicator in arrow mode.

constant.Name: SCROLL_COLOR_AU_BG
constant.Comment: The background fill color for the scroll indicator (in bar mode) when used for an Alert. If no images can be loaded, this color is used to render the background of a scrollbar.

constant.Name: SCROLL_COLOR_AU_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground fill color for the scroll indicator (in bar mode) when used for an Alert. If no images can be loaded, this color is used to render the foreground of a scrollbar.

constant.Name: SCROLL_IMAGE_AU_BG
constant.Comment: A 3 piece background image to use to render the background of the scroll indicator (in bar mode) when used for an Alert. Piece 0: Top cap of the bar. Piece 1: Middle tile of the bar. Piece 2: Bottom cap of the bar. These images are used to render a background for the scrollbar. If the combined heights of the top, middle, and bottom images is less than the overall height of the scrollbar, the middle image will be tiled vertically to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: SCROLL_IMAGE_AU_FG
constant.Comment: A 3 piece foreground image to use to render the 'thumb' of the scroll indicator (in bar mode) when used for an Alert. Piece 0: Top cap of the thumb. Piece 1: Middle tile of the thumb. Piece 2: Bottom cap of the thumb. These images are used to render a foreground for the scrollbar. If the combined heights of the top, middle, and bottom images is less than the overall height of the thumb, the middle image will be tiled vertically to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of foreground image.

constant.Name: SCROLL_IMAGE_AU_UP
constant.Comment: The 'up' arrow for a scroll indicator in arrow mode for an Alert.

constant.Name: SCROLL_IMAGE_AU_DN
constant.Comment: The 'down' arrow for a scroll indicator in arrow mode for an Alert.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The overall height of the soft button bar.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_NUM_BUTTONS
constant.Comment: The number of 'soft buttons' to represent on the soft button bar, typically 2.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_BUTTON_SHD_ALIGN
constant.Comment: Specifies the alignment property of the drop shadow on the button text. This should be a combination value such as Graphics.TOP | Graphics.LEFT or Graphics.RIGHT | Graphics.BOTTOM.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The text foreground color for buttons.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_COLOR_FG_SHD
constant.Comment: The text drop-shadow color for buttons.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The solid fill-color for the button bar. If the background image isn't specified or cannot be loaded, this fill color will be used.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_COLOR_MU_FG
constant.Comment: The text foreground color for buttons on the button bar when the system menu is up.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_COLOR_MU_FG_SHD
constant.Comment: The text drop-shadow color for buttons on the button bar when the system menu is up.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_COLOR_MU_BG
constant.Comment: The solid fill-color for the button bar when the system menu is up. If the background image isn't specified or cannot be loaded, this fill color will be used.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_COLOR_AU_FG
constant.Comment: The text foreground color for buttons on the button bar when a system alert is up.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_COLOR_AU_FG_SHD
constant.Comment: The text drop-shadow color for buttons on the button bar when a system alert is up.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_COLOR_AU_BG
constant.Comment: The solid fill-color for the button bar when a system alert is up. If the background image isn't specified or cannot be loaded, this fill color will be used.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_FONT
constant.Comment: The font to use to render the softbutton text.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_TEXT_MENUCMD
constant.Comment: The soft button label to use to represent that pressing that soft button will bring up the system menu, typically 'Menu'.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_TEXT_BACKCMD
constant.Comment: The soft button label to use for the command which closes the system menu once it is opened, typically 'Back'.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: The 3 piece background image for the button bar. Piece 0: Left edge of the button bar. Piece 1: Middle tile of the button bar. Piece 2: Right edge of the button bar. These images are used to render a background for the button bar. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the button bar, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_IMAGE_MU_BG
constant.Comment: The 3 piece background image for the button bar when the system menu is up. Piece 0: Left edge of the button bar. Piece 1: Middle tile of the button bar. Piece 2: Right edge of the button bar. These images are used to render a background for the button bar. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the button bar, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background iamge.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_IMAGE_AU_BG
constant.Comment: The 3 piece background image for the button bar when a system alert is up. Piece 0: Left edge of the button bar. Piece 1: Middle tile of the button bar. Piece 2: Right edge of the button bar. These images are used to render a background for the button bar. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the button bar, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: TICKER_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The overall height of this ticker (in pixels).

constant.Name: TICKER_ALIGN
constant.Comment: The vertical alignment of this ticker, can be either Graphics.TOP or Graphics.BOTTOM.

constant.Name: TICKER_DIRECTION
constant.Comment: The direction of motion of the text in this ticker. Valid values are either Graphics.RIGHT or Graphics.LEFT, meaning text moves to the right or to the left, respectively.

constant.Name: TICKER_RATE
constant.Comment: The amount of time (in milliseconds) between subsequent ticker text updates. This is the rate of animation for the ticker text. For example, a value of 500 would move the text across the ticker two times per second. The distance the text would move per update is defined by TICKER_SPEED.

constant.Name: TICKER_SPEED
constant.Comment: The rate of movement per cycle for the ticker text (measured in pixels). This is the amount of travel (in pixels) the text will move for each update of the ticker.

constant.Name: TICKER_TEXT_ANCHOR_Y
constant.Comment: The y-coordinate of the anchor point for the ticker text. This value represents the TOP of the ticker text.

constant.Name: TICKER_TEXT_SHD_ALIGN
constant.Comment: The alignment directive for the drop shadow of the ticker text. If this ticker has a drop shadow, this directive specified where to align the drop shadow. Valid values are: Graphics.TOP | Graphics.LEFT, Graphics.TOP | Graphics.RIGHT, Graphics.BOTTOM | Graphics.LEFT, Graphics.BOTTOM | Graphics.RIGHT.

constant.Name: TICKER_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The background fill color for this ticker if its background image isn't specified or cannot be loaded.

constant.Name: TICKER_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground color for rendering the text of this ticker.

constant.Name: TICKER_COLOR_FG_SHD
constant.Comment: The drop-shadow color of the text of this ticker.

constant.Name: TICKER_FONT
constant.Comment: The font to render the text of this ticker.

constant.Name: TICKER_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: The 3 piece background image to be used for this ticker. Piece 0: Left edge of the ticker. Piece 1: Middle tile of the ticker. Piece 2: Right edge of the ticker. These images are used to render a background for the ticker. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the ticker, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: TICKER_IMAGE_AU_BG
constant.Comment: The 3 piece background image to be used for this ticker when a system alert is visible. Piece 0: Left edge of the ticker. Piece 1: Middle tile of the ticker. Piece 2: Right edge of the ticker. These images are used to render a background for the ticker.If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the ticker, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: PTI_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The overall height of this ticker (in pixels).

constant.Name: PTI_MARGIN
constant.Comment: The text margin in PTI bar (in pixels).

constant.Name: PTI_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The background fill color for this pti bar if its background image isn't specified or cannot be loaded.

constant.Name: PTI_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground color for rendering the text of this pti bar.

constant.Name: PTI_COLOR_FG_HL
constant.Comment: The highlighted color of the text of this pti bar.

constant.Name: PTI_COLOR_BG_HL
constant.Comment: The highlighted color of the background of this pti bar.

constant.Name: PTI_COLOR_BDR
constant.Comment: The color of the background of this pti bar.

constant.Name: PTI_FONT
constant.Comment: The font to render the text of this ticker.

constant.Name: PTI_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: These images are used to render a background for the pti bar. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: PTI_LEFT_ARROW
constant.Comment: Left scrolling indicator for PTI bar

constant.Name: PTI_RIGHT_ARROW
constant.Comment: Right scrolling indicator for PTI bar

constant.Name: INPUT_MODE_MARGIN
constant.Comment: The text margin in Input Mode Indicator (in pixels).

constant.Name: INPUT_MODE_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The background fill color for this pti bar if its background image isn't specified or cannot be loaded.

constant.Name: INPUT_MODE_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground color for rendering the text of this Input Mode Indicator.

constant.Name: INPUT_MODE_COLOR_BDR
constant.Comment: The color of the background of this Input Mode Indicator.

constant.Name: INPUT_MODE_FONT
constant.Comment: The font to render the text of this Input Mode Indicator.

constant.Name: INPUT_MODE_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: These images are used to render a background for the Input Mode Indicator. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: TITLE_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The overall height of the title component, including its background, title text, etc.

constant.Name: TITLE_MARGIN
constant.Comment: The margin (in pixels) to leave on either side of the layer when rendering its text.

constant.Name: TITLE_TEXT_ALIGN_X
constant.Comment: Specifies the horizontal alignment of the text, can be Graphics.LEFT, RIGHT, or HCENTER.

constant.Name: TITLE_TEXT_SHD_ALIGN
constant.Comment: Specifies the alignment property of the drop shadow on the title text. This should be a combination value such as Graphics.TOP | Graphics.LEFT or Graphics.RIGHT | Graphics.BOTTOM

constant.Name: TITLE_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground color to use when rendering the title text.

constant.Name: TITLE_COLOR_FG_SHD
constant.Comment: The 'shadow' color to use when rendering the title text. The title's shadow is a drop shadow of the text appearing behind the foreground color text. If this color is equal to that of the foreground color, no drop shadow will be drawn.

constant.Name: TITLE_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: A background fill color to use if there is no background image.

constant.Name: TITLE_FONT
constant.Comment: The Font to use when rendering the title text.

constant.Name: TITLE_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: The 3 piece background image to be used in the 'title bar'. Piece 0: Left edge of the titlebar. Piece 1: Middle tile of the titlebar. Piece 2: Right edge of the titlebar. These images are used to render a background for the titlebar. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the titlebar, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, either the tile image or solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: ALERT_WIDTH
constant.Comment: The overall width of an Alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The height for an Alert. Alerts taller than this height will require scrolling.

constant.Name: ALERT_ALIGN_X
constant.Comment: The horizontal alignment of an Alert on the screen. Valid values are Graphics.LEFT, Graphics.HCENTER, and Graphics.RIGHT.

constant.Name: ALERT_ALIGN_Y
constant.Comment: The vertical alignment of an Alert on the screen. Valid values are Graphics.TOP, Graphics.VCENTER, and Graphics.BOTTOM.

constant.Name: ALERT_MARGIN_H
constant.Comment: The width (in pixels) for the horizontal margins for an alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_MARGIN_V
constant.Comment: The height (in pixels) for the vertical margins for an alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_TITLE_ALIGN
constant.Comment: The alignment directive for the title in the title bar. Valid values are Graphics.LEFT, Graphics.HCENTER, or Graphics.RIGHT. This value will be combined with Graphics.TOP to locate the title in the Alert's title bar, centered vertically.

constant.Name: ALERT_TITLE_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The overall height of the 'title bar' of the Alert. This height accounts for the area at the top of the Alert where the icon and the title are located. The rest of the alert constitutes the 'body' of the Alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_TITLE_MARGIN
constant.Comment: The width of the margin (in pixels) on either side of the title in an Alert. If the title exceeds the available width, it will be clipped at the margins.

constant.Name: ALERT_TEXT_TITLE_INFO
constant.Comment: The default title for an 'info' type alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_TEXT_TITLE_WARN
constant.Comment: The default title for a 'warning' type alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_TEXT_TITLE_ERRR
constant.Comment: The default title for an 'error' type alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_TEXT_TITLE_ALRM
constant.Comment: The default title for an 'alarm' type alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_TEXT_TITLE_CNFM
constant.Comment: The default title for a 'confirm' type alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_PAD_HORIZ
constant.Comment: The amount of padding (in pixels) between some elements on a row (such as the icon and the title).

constant.Name: ALERT_PAD_VERT
constant.Comment: The amount of padding (in pixels) between two rows of elements.

constant.Name: ALERT_SCROLL_AMOUNT
constant.Comment: The amount of pixels to scroll the contents of the Alert at one time.

constant.Name: ALERT_TIMEOUT
constant.Comment: The timeout (in milliseconds) for an Alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The background fill color to be used for Alerts when the background image cannot be loaded or does not exist.

constant.Name: ALERT_COLOR_TITLE
constant.Comment: The foreground color for the Alert's title text.

constant.Name: ALERT_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground color for the Alert's contents.

constant.Name: ALERT_FONT_TITLE
constant.Comment: The font to use to render the Alert's title text.

constant.Name: ALERT_FONT_TEXT
constant.Comment: The font to use to render the Alert's contents.

constant.Name: ALERT_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: A 9-piece background to use for an Alert. Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. The top-bar is the area where the Alert icon and title are drawn. If there is no Alert title, the top-bar may be very short, and serves to visually cap the top of the Alert. The middle-bar is the background 'tile' for a row of the middle of an Alert. It will be repeatedly drawn vertically to accommodate the height of the Alert. The bottom-bar is the bottom border of the Alert and serves to visually cap the bottom of the Alert. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the Alert, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of image background.

constant.Name: ALERT_IMAGE_ICON_INFO
constant.Comment: The icon for an 'Information' type Alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_IMAGE_ICON_WARN
constant.Comment: The icon for an 'Warning' type Alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_IMAGE_ICON_ERRR
constant.Comment: The icon for an 'Error' type Alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_IMAGE_ICON_ALRM
constant.Comment: The icon for an 'Alarm' type Alert.

constant.Name: ALERT_IMAGE_ICON_CNFM
constant.Comment: The icon for an 'Confirmation' type Alert.

constant.Name: BUSYCRSR_WIDTH
constant.Comment: The width of the continuous gauge. This is the width of the UI design. It does not include label support which may be provided automatically in addition to this measurement.

constant.Name: BUSYCRSR_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The height of the continuous gauge. This is the height of the UI design. It does not include label support which may be provided automatically in addition to this measurement.

constant.Name: BUSYCRSR_NUM_FRAMES
constant.Comment: The number of frames that contribute to the animation of this continuous gauge.

constant.Name: BUSYCRSR_FRAME_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate of the animation region of the continuous gauge as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space, where the frames get painted. If the animation is small in size, the frames could be of that small size and given this 'x' co-ordinate, the frames would get painted there. The frames will be placed with their upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: BUSYCRSR_FRAME_Y
constant.Comment: The 'y' coordinate of the animation region of the continuous gauge as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space, where the frames get painted. If the animation is small in size, the frames could be of that small size and given this 'y' co-ordinate, the frames would get painted there. The frames will be placed with their upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: BUSYCRSR_FRAME_SEQU
constant.Comment: The sequence in which the frames should be animated in this continuous gauge.

constant.Name: BUSYCRSR_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: The image to be used for the background body of the continuous gauge, without any animation related images.

constant.Name: BUSYCRSR_IMAGE_FRAME
constant.Comment: All the images (frames), total BUSYCRSR_NUM_FRAMES images, that contribute to the animation of this continuous gauge.

constant.Name: CHOICE_WIDTH_IMAGE
constant.Comment: The maximum width for an application-supplied image for a choice element.

constant.Name: CHOICE_HEIGHT_IMAGE
constant.Comment: The maximum height for an application-supplied image for a choice element.

constant.Name: CHOICE_WIDTH_SCROLL
constant.Comment: In a popup choice, the width of the scrollbar.

constant.Name: CHOICE_WIDTH_THUMB
constant.Comment: In a popup choice, the width of the thumb of the scrollbar.

constant.Name: CHOICE_HEIGHT_THUMB
constant.Comment: In a popup choice, the height of the thumb of the scrollbar.

constant.Name: CHOICE_PAD_H
constant.Comment: The horizontal padding (in pixels) to use between elements on the same line.

constant.Name: CHOICE_PAD_V
constant.Comment: The vertical padding (in pixels) to use between elements on the same line.

constant.Name: CHOICE_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground color for this popup choice.

constant.Name: CHOICE_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The background color for this popup choice.

constant.Name: CHOICE_COLOR_BRDR
constant.Comment: The border color for this popup choice.

constant.Name: CHOICE_COLOR_BRDR_SHD
constant.Comment: The border shadow color for this popup choice.

constant.Name: CHOICE_COLOR_SCROLL
constant.Comment: The color of the scrollbar on a popup choice.

constant.Name: CHOICE_COLOR_THUMB
constant.Comment: The color of the scrollbar thumb on a popup choice.

constant.Name: CHOICE_FONT
constant.Comment: The font to use for choice elements.

constant.Name: CHOICE_FONT_FOCUS
constant.Comment: The font to use for the currently focused choice element.

constant.Name: CHOICE_IMAGE_RADIO
constant.Comment: The pair of images for radio buttons. Piece 0: The image for the 'off' radio button. Piece 1: The image for the 'on' radio button. Both images should be of the same dimensions.

constant.Name: CHOICE_IMAGE_CHKBX
constant.Comment: The pair of images for checkboxes. Piece 0: The image for the 'unchecked' checkbox. Piece 1: The image for the 'checked' checkbox. Both images should be of the same dimensions.

constant.Name: CHOICE_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: A 9 piece image background for a popup choicegroup. Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. The top-bar is the top border for the popup. The middle-bar is the left/right borders as well as the center tile for the popup. The bottom-bar is the bottom border of the popup. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the datefield, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: CHOICE_IMAGE_BTN_BG
constant.Comment: A 9 piece image background to use to draw the 'popup' button for popup choicegroup. Once the button background is drawn, the icon will be placed in its center. Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the background, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: CHOICE_IMAGE_BTN_ICON
constant.Comment: The image to use to indicate the drop-down nature of the popup choice, typically a 'down arrow'.

constant.Name: CHOICE_IMAGE_POPUP_BG
constant.Comment: The 9 piece image background to use for the background of a popup choice window. Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the background, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The height (in pixels) of the popup date editor.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_HEIGHT_POPUPS
constant.Comment: The maximum height allowed for internal popups, like month, year, hours, etc.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_WIDTH_D
constant.Comment: The width (in pixels) of the popup date editor in 'date' mode.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_WIDTH_T
constant.Comment: The width (in pixels) of the popup date editor in 'time' mode.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_WIDTH_DT
constant.Comment: The width (in pixels) of the popup date editor in 'date/time' mode.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The background color of the popup editor (if the background image either can't be found or loaded).

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_COLOR_POPUPS_BG
constant.Comment: The background color for the popups, such as hours, minutes, month, etc.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_COLOR_BRDR
constant.Comment: The border color of the popup editor (if the background image either can't be found or loaded).

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_COLOR_TRAV_IND
constant.Comment: The color of the traverse indicator within the editor popup.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_COLOR_CLK_LT
constant.Comment: The color to draw the hands of the clock.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_COLOR_CLK_DK
constant.Comment: The shadow color to draw the hands of the clock.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_FONT_POPUPS
constant.Comment: The font to use for rendering options inside the popups, like hours, minutes, month, etc.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: The 9 piece image background to use to draw the background of the popup editor.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_MON_BG
constant.Comment: The background image for the drop-down month selector.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_YR_BG
constant.Comment: The background image for the drop-down year selector.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_CAL_BG
constant.Comment: The background image for rendering the calendar.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_DATES
constant.Comment: This is a single image which holds all the dates as graphics. The image is arranged vertically, starting with 1 and going to 31. Each digit is equal height and centered in the image.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_DAYS
constant.Comment: This is a single image which holds all the days of week as graphics. The image is arranged horizontally, starting with 1 and going to 7. Each letter is equal height and centered in the image.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_TIME_BG
constant.Comment: The background image for the drop-down hour/minute selected.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_RADIO
constant.Comment: Two radio button images for the am/pm setting. The first image is the unselected radio button and the second image is the selected radio image.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_AMPM
constant.Comment: This is a single image which holds the graphics for the am/pm text. The image contains the am and pm graphic arranged horizontally such that the left half of the image is the am graphic and the right half of the image is the pm graphic.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_CLOCK_BG
constant.Comment: The background image for the clock.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_PAD_H
constant.Comment: The horizontal padding (in pixels) between the left and right borders of a datefield and its contents.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_PAD_V
constant.Comment: The vertical padding (in pixels) between the top and bottom borders of a text component and its contents.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_BTN_BRDR_W
constant.Comment: For the 'popup' button (with a non-existing image background), the width in pixels of the line border to draw around the button.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_FONT
constant.Comment: The font to use for the text in this datefield.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground color for this datefield.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The background color for this datefield.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_COLOR_BRDR
constant.Comment: The border color for this datefield.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_COLOR_BRDR_LT
constant.Comment: The 'light' line border color for the 'popup' button (with a non-existing image background).

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_COLOR_BRDR_DK
constant.Comment: The 'dark' line border color for the 'popup' button (with a non-existing image background).

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_COLOR_BRDR_SHD
constant.Comment: The border shadow color for this datefield.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: A 9 piece image background for a datefield. Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. The top-bar is the top border for the datefield. The middle-bar is the left/right borders as well as the center tile for the datefield. The bottom-bar is the bottom border of the datefield. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the datefield, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_IMAGE_BTN_BG
constant.Comment: A 9 piece image background for the 'popup' button which holds the specific icon for this datefield. Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width needed for the button, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_IMAGE_ICON_DATE
constant.Comment: An icon for the popup button for a date only datefield.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_IMAGE_ICON_TIME
constant.Comment: An icon for the popup button for a time only datefield.

constant.Name: DATEFIELD_IMAGE_ICON_DATETIME
constant.Comment: An icon for the popup button for a date and time datefield.

constant.Name: GAUGE_ORIENT
constant.Comment: The orientation of the interactive gauge. The value indicates the directionality of the gauge as it goes from 0 to its max value. Valid values are Skin.LEFT, Skin.RIGHT, Skin.UP, and Skin.DOWN. A value of Skin.RIGHT, for example, would indicate a gauge which increased in value from left to right.

constant.Name: GAUGE_WIDTH
constant.Comment: The width of the interactive gauge. This is the width of the UI design. It does not include label support which may be provided automatically in addition to this measurement.

constant.Name: GAUGE_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The height of the interactive gauge. This is the height of the UI design. It does not include label support which may be provided automatically in addition to this measurement.

constant.Name: GAUGE_METER_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate of the meter image for this interactive gauge, as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space. The meter image will be placed with its upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: GAUGE_METER_Y
constant.Comment: The 'y' coordinate of the meter image for this interactive gauge, as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space. The meter image will be placed with its upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: GAUGE_INC_BTN_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate of the increase button for this interactive gauge, as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space. The button will be placed with its upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: GAUGE_INC_BTN_Y
constant.Comment: The 'y' coordinate of the increase button for this interactive gauge, as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space. The button will be placed with its upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: GAUGE_DEC_BTN_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate of the decrease button for this interactive gauge, as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space. The button will be placed with its upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: GAUGE_DEC_BTN_Y
constant.Comment: The 'y' coordinate of the decrease button for this interactive gauge, as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space. The button will be placed with its upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: GAUGE_VALUE_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate defining the upper left corner of the bounding box which contains the interactive gauge's value.

constant.Name: GAUGE_VALUE_Y
constant.Comment: The 'y' coordinate defining the upper left corner of the bounding box which contains the interactive gauge's value.

constant.Name: GAUGE_VALUE_WIDTH
constant.Comment: The maximum allowable width of the space available to render the value of the interactive gauge. For example, a gauge may be able to easily render the value of 45, but it may not be large enough to render 4500000. The height of the gauge value is determined by the image used to provide the numbers.

constant.Name: GAUGE_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: The image to be used for the background body of the interactive gauge, without the meter images, value, or control buttons.

constant.Name: GAUGE_IMAGE_MTR_EMPTY
constant.Comment: The image to be used for the actual meter of the interactive gauge, in an 'empty' (ie value==0) state.

constant.Name: GAUGE_IMAGE_MTR_FULL
constant.Comment: The image to be used for the actual meter of the interactive gauge, in a 'full' (ie value==max) state.

constant.Name: GAUGE_IMAGE_INC_BTN
constant.Comment: The image to be used for the 'increase' button for this interactive gauge.

constant.Name: GAUGE_IMAGE_DEC_BTN
constant.Comment: The image to be used for the 'decrease' button for this interactive gauge.

constant.Name: GAUGE_IMAGE_VALUES
constant.Comment: The image to be used to paint the value of this interactive gauge in a numerical form. The image should consist of the highlighted/normal values 0-9, and a trailing non-highlighted/grayish 0, that could be used to display a value of 0. The digits should be equally spaced in a horizontal layout. Each digit should be the same width, equal to the width of the overall image divided by 11 (the total number of digits in the image, 0-9,0).

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_COLOR_BG_LNK_FOC
constant.Comment: The background fill color of a hyperlink which has input focus.

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_COLOR_BG_BTN
constant.Comment: The background fill color of a button.

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_COLOR_BORDER_LT
constant.Comment: The 'light' line border color of a button which does not have an image background.

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_COLOR_BORDER_DK
constant.Comment: The 'dark' line border color of a button which does not have an image background.

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_PAD_LNK_H
constant.Comment: The padding between the sides of an image and its outer border when it is a hyperlink.

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_PAD_LNK_V
constant.Comment: The padding between the top and bottom of an image and its outer border when it is a hyperlink.

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_PAD_BTN_H
constant.Comment: The padding between the sides of an image and its outer border when it is a button.

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_PAD_BTN_V
constant.Comment: The padding between the top and bottom of an image and its outer border when it is a button.

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_BTN_BORDER_W
constant.Comment: The thickness of the line border drawn around the image when it is a button (and its background image is not available).

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_IMAGE_LNK_H
constant.Comment: The 'horizontal' portion of the border graphic to draw around an image when it is a hyperlink.

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_IMAGE_LNK_V
constant.Comment: The 'vertical' portion of the border graphic to draw around an image when it is a hyperlink.

constant.Name: IMAGEITEM_IMAGE_BUTTON
constant.Comment: The 9 piece image background for an image which is a button. Piece 0: Top left corner of the button. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top of the button. Piece 2: Top right corner of the button. Piece 3: Left edge of the button. Piece 4: Middle tile for the button. Piece 5: Right edge of the button. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the button. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom of the button. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the button. All three rows are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the button, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color and line border are used instead of background image.

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: Height of virtual keyboard

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_COEFFICIENT
constant.Comment: The persent of the board which virtual keyboard fill

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_KEY
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_BACKSPACE
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_CAPS
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_ENTER
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_ALPHA_MODE
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_SYMBOL_MODE
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_NUMERIC_MODE
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BG
constant.Comment: Background for virtual keyboard

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: Background color for virtual keyboard

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_UP_SEL
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key with selected up arrow

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_UP_UN
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key with unselected up arrow

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_LEFT_SEL
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key with selected left arrow

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_LEFT_UN
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key with unselected left arrow

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_MID_SEL
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key with selected middle icon

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_MID_UN
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key with unselected middle icon

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_RIGHT_SEL
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key with selected right arrow

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_RIGHT_UN
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key with unselected right arrow

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_DOWN_SEL
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key with selected down arrow

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_BTN_DOWN_UN
constant.Comment: Image for virtual keyboard key with unselected down arrow

constant.Name: KEYBOARD_FONT
constant.Comment: Virtual keyboard font

constant.Name: TOUCH_RADIUS
constant.Comment: Radius of finger if finger support is on, if finger support is off than this constant should be 0

constant.Name: MENU_WIDTH
constant.Comment: The maximum overall width of the system menu component.

constant.Name: MENU_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The maximum overall height of the system menu component.

constant.Name: MENU_ALIGN_X
constant.Comment: The alignment property of the system menu on the 'x' axis. Valid values are Graphics.LEFT, Graphics.RIGHT, or Graphics.HCENTER. A value of LEFT, for example, would align the system menu on the left edge of the screen. A value of RIGHT would align the menu along the right edge of the screen, and a value of HCENTER would horizontally center the system menu on the screen.

constant.Name: MENU_ALIGN_Y
constant.Comment: The alignment property of the system menu on the 'y' axis. Valid values are Graphics.TOP, Graphics.BOTTOM, or Graphics.VCENTER. A value of TOP, for example, would align the system menu along the top edge of the screen. A value of BOTTOM would align the menu along the bottom edge of the screen, and a value of VCENTER would vertically center the system menu on the screen.

constant.Name: MENU_TITLE_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate for the anchor point of the system menu title.

constant.Name: MENU_TITLE_Y
constant.Comment: The 'y' coordinate for the anchor point of the system menu title.

constant.Name: MENU_TITLE_MAXWIDTH
constant.Comment: The maximum width allowed for hte system menu title.

constant.Name: MENU_TITLE_ALIGN
constant.Comment: The horizontal alignment property of the system menu title around its anchor point. Valid values are Graphics.LEFT, Graphics.RIGHT, and Graphics.HCENTER.

constant.Name: MENU_MAX_ITEMS
constant.Comment: The max items this system menu can display at once.

constant.Name: MENU_ITEM_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The height (in pixels) of each option in the system menu. This height includes any padding, and is the total height occupied by a single 'row' which makes up an item. The next item in the menu would have its origin y-value at ITEM_HEIGHT + 1.

constant.Name: MENU_ITEM_TOPOFFSET
constant.Comment: The offset (in pixels) from the top of the menu to the origin y-value of the first menu item.

constant.Name: MENU_ITEM_INDEX_ANCHOR_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate of the starting location for the index of each menu item. That is, menu items are made up of an index and a string, ie, '5 Help Menu'. This coordinate is for the numeric index of the items. All item indexes will have the same x coordinate.

constant.Name: MENU_ITEM_ANCHOR_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate of the starting location for the string value of each menu item. That is, menu items are made up of an index and a string, ie, '5 Help Menu'. This coordinate is for the string value of the items. All item strings will have the same x coordinate.

constant.Name: MENU_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: A background fill color to use in lieu of using a background image.

constant.Name: MENU_COLOR_BG_SEL
constant.Comment: A background fill color to use for the currently highlighted menu item and index in lieu of using a background image.

constant.Name: MENU_COLOR_TITLE
constant.Comment: The foreground color to use to render the system menu title if one is used.

constant.Name: MENU_COLOR_INDEX
constant.Comment: The non-selected foreground color to use to render the index of each item on the menu.

constant.Name: MENU_COLOR_INDEX_SEL
constant.Comment: The foreground color to use to render the index of the selected item on the menu.

constant.Name: MENU_COLOR_ITEM
constant.Comment: The non-selected foreground color to use to render items on the menu.

constant.Name: MENU_COLOR_ITEM_SEL
constant.Comment: The foreground color to use to render the selected item on the menu.

constant.Name: MENU_TEXT_TITLE
constant.Comment: The actual title of the system menu, typically 'Menu'. If isn't specified, then this system menu does not have a title.

constant.Name: MENU_FONT_TITLE
constant.Comment: The Font to use to render the system menu title.

constant.Name: MENU_FONT_ITEM
constant.Comment: The Font to use to render all non-selected items and their indexes on the menu.

constant.Name: MENU_FONT_ITEM_SEL
constant.Comment: The Font to use to render the currently selected item and its index on the menu.

constant.Name: MENU_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: The 9 piece background image to be used for the system menu. Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the item-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the item-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the item-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. The top-bar is the area where the menu title is drawn. If there is no menu title, the top-bar may be very short, and serves to visually cap the top of the menu. The item-bar is the background 'tile' for a single menu item. It will be repeatedly drawn vertically to accommodate each line for each menu item. The bottom-bar is the bottom border of the system menu and serves to visually cap the bottom of the menu. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the system menu, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: MENU_IMAGE_ITEM_SEL_BG
constant.Comment: The 3 piece background image for a selected menu item. Piece 0: Left edge of the selected item-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile of the selected item-bar. Piece 2: Right edge of the selected item-bar. These images are used to render a special background for the currently selected menu item. They should match in height to those images used for the non-selected item-bar. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the system menu, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: MENU_IMAGE_SUBMENU
constant.Comment: Some menu items may trigger a cascading submenu. In this case the menu item may be additionally displayed with a directional arrow indicating the availability of a submenu. This image is the arrow to be displayed when a menu item is not currently selected.

constant.Name: MENU_IMAGE_SUBMENU_HL
constant.Comment: Some menu items may trigger a cascading submenu. In this case the menu item may be additionally displayed with a directional arrow indicating the availability of a submenu. This image is the arrow to be displayed when a menu item is currently selected.

constant.Name: PBAR_ORIENT
constant.Comment: The orientation of the progressbar. The value indicates the directionality of the progressbar as it goes from 0 to its max value. Valid values are Skin.LEFT, Skin.RIGHT, Skin.UP, and Skin.DOWN. A value of Skin.RIGHT, for example, would indicate a gauge which increased in value from left to right.

constant.Name: PBAR_WIDTH
constant.Comment: The width of the progressbar. This is the width of the UI design. It does not include label support which may be provided automatically in addition to this measurement.

constant.Name: PBAR_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The height of the progressbar. This is the height of the UI design. It does not include label support which may be provided automatically in addition to this measurement.

constant.Name: PBAR_METER_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate of the meter image for this progressbar, as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space. The meter image will be placed with its upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: PBAR_METER_Y
constant.Comment: The 'y' coordinate of the meter image for this progressbar, as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space. The meter image will be placed with its upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: PBAR_VALUE_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate defining the upper left corner of the bounding box which contains the progressbar's value.

constant.Name: PBAR_VALUE_Y
constant.Comment: The 'y' coordinate defining the upper left corner of the bounding box which contains the progressbar's value.

constant.Name: PBAR_VALUE_WIDTH
constant.Comment: The maximum allowable width of the space available to render the value of the progressbar as a percentage. For example, it would range from a 0% to a 100%, which is the maximum. The actual value of the gauge is scaled according to the maximum value of the gauge as a percentage. The height of the gauge value is determined by the image used to provide the numbers.

constant.Name: PBAR_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: The image to be used for the background body of the progressbar, without the meter images, value and percentage.

constant.Name: PBAR_IMAGE_MTR_EMPTY
constant.Comment: The image to be used for the actual meter of this progressbar, in an 'empty' (ie value==0) state.

constant.Name: PBAR_IMAGE_MTR_FULL
constant.Comment: The image to be used for the actual meter of this progressbar, in a 'full' (ie value==max) state.

constant.Name: PBAR_IMAGE_VALUES
constant.Comment: The image to be used to paint the value of this progressbar in a numerical form. The image should consist of the highlighted/normal values 0-9, and a trailing non-highlighted/grayish 0, that could be used to display a value of 0. The digits should be equally spaced in a horizontal layout. Each digit should be the same width, equal to the width of the overall image divided by 11 (the total number of digits in the image, 0-9,0).

constant.Name: PBAR_IMAGE_PERCENTS
constant.Comment: The image to be used to clip the percentage sign from. The percentage sign is displayed right next to the (percentage equivalent) current value of the progressbar. It consists of 2 percentage signs, one normal/highlighted and the other showing non-highlighted/grayish rendering, that could be used when displaying a value of 0%. The 2 signs should be equally spaced in a horizontal layout and be the same width, equal to the width of the overall image divided by 2 (the total number of signs in the image).

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_PAD_BUTTON_H
constant.Comment: In button mode, the number of pixels between the sides of the button and its text.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_PAD_BUTTON_V
constant.Comment: In button mode, the number of pixels between the top and bottom of the button and its text.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_BUTTON_BORDER_W
constant.Comment: In button mode (with a non-existing image background), the width in pixels of the line border to draw around the button.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_COLOR_FG_LNK
constant.Comment: The foreground text color of a hyperlink.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_COLOR_FG_LNK_FOC
constant.Comment: The foreground text color of a hyperlink which has input focus.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_COLOR_BG_LNK_FOC
constant.Comment: The background fill color of a hyperlink which has input focus. If this value is -1, there will be no background fill.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_COLOR_FG_BTN
constant.Comment: The foreground text color of a button.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_COLOR_BG_BTN
constant.Comment: The background fill color of a button (with a non-existing image background).

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_COLOR_BORDER_LT
constant.Comment: The 'light' line border color for a button (with a non-existing image background).

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_COLOR_BORDER_DK
constant.Comment: The 'dark' line border color for a button (with a non-existing image background).

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_FONT
constant.Comment: The font to use for a plain StringItem.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_FONT_LNK
constant.Comment: The font to use for a hyperlink.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_FONT_BTN
constant.Comment: The font to use for a button.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_IMAGE_LNK
constant.Comment: The image to use to draw the link underline below a hyperlink.

constant.Name: STRINGITEM_IMAGE_BTN
constant.Comment: The 9 piece image background to use for a button. Piece 0: Top left corner of the button. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top of the button. Piece 2: Top right corner of the button. Piece 3: Left edge of the button. Piece 4: Middle tile for the button. Piece 5: Right edge of the button. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the button. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom of the button. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the button. All three rows are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the button, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color and line border are used instead of background image.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_PAD_H
constant.Comment: The horizontal padding (in pixels) between the left and right borders of a text component and its contents.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_PAD_V
constant.Comment: The vertical padding (in pixels) between the top and bottom borders of a text component and its contents.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_BOX_MARGIN
constant.Comment: The size of the inset margin for a full-screen textbox component. This will create an inset margin on the screen, literally creating a 'box' onscreen which will contain the text input.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_WIDTH_CARET
constant.Comment: The width (in pixels) for the caret (input cursor) in a text input component.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_SCRL_RATE
constant.Comment: For auto-scrolling text, this is the rate (in milliseconds) between updates of the scrolling text. For example, a value of 100 will move the text ten times in one second.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_SCRL_SPD
constant.Comment: For auto-scrolling text, the number of pixels to shift the text in a single update. This value combines with TEXTFIELD_SCRL_RATE to define auto-scrolling behavior. The text will move a certain number of pixels every so many milliseconds.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_COLOR_FG
constant.Comment: The foreground color for this text component.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_COLOR_BG
constant.Comment: The background color for this text component.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_COLOR_BRDR
constant.Comment: The border color for this text component.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_COLOR_BRDR_SHD
constant.Comment: The border shadow color for this text component.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_COLOR_FG_UE
constant.Comment: The foreground color for an uneditable text component.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_COLOR_BG_UE
constant.Comment: The background color for an uneditable text component.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_COLOR_BRDR_UE
constant.Comment: The border color for an uneditable text component.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_COLOR_BRDR_SHD_UE
constant.Comment: The border shadow color for an uneditable text component.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: A 9 piece image background for a text component. Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. The top-bar is the top border for the text component. The middle-bar is the left/right borders as well as the center tile for the text component. The bottom-bar is the bottom border of the text component. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the text component, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: TEXTFIELD_IMAGE_BG_UE
constant.Comment: A 9 piece image background for an uneditable text component. Piece 0: Top left corner of the top-bar. Piece 1: Middle tile for the top-bar. Piece 2: Top right corner of the top-bar. Piece 3: Left edge of the middle-bar. Piece 4: Middle tile for the middle-bar. Piece 5: Right edge of the middle-bar. Piece 6: Bottom left corner of the bottom-bar. Piece 7: Middle tile for the bottom-bar. Piece 8: Bottom right corner of the bottom-bar. The top-bar is the top border for the text component. The middle-bar is the left/right borders as well as the center tile for the text component. The bottom-bar is the bottom border of the text component. All three bars are divided into three pieces, a left, a middle, and a right. If the combined widths of the left, middle, and right images is less than the overall width of the text component, the middle image will be tiled horizontally to make up the difference. If isn't specified or cannot be loaded, solid fill color is used instead of background image.

constant.Name: UPDATEBAR_WIDTH
constant.Comment: The width of the incremental updating gauge. This is the width of the UI design. It does not include label support which may be provided automatically in addition to this measurement.

constant.Name: UPDATEBAR_HEIGHT
constant.Comment: The height of the incremental updating gauge. This is the height of the UI design. It does not include label support which may be provided automatically in addition to this measurement.

constant.Name: UPDATEBAR_NUM_FRAMES
constant.Comment: The number of frames that contribute to the animation of this incremental updating gauge.

constant.Name: UPDATEBAR_FRAME_X
constant.Comment: The 'x' coordinate of the animation region of the incremental updating gauge as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space, where the frames get painted. If the animation is small in size, the frames could be of that small size and given this 'x' co-ordinate, the frames would get painted there. The frames will be placed with their upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: UPDATEBAR_FRAME_Y
constant.Comment: The 'y' coordinate of the animation region of the incremental updating gauge as measured in the gauge's own coordinate space, where the frames get painted. If the animation is small in size, the frames could be of that small size and given this 'y' co-ordinate, the frames would get painted there. The frames will be placed with their upper left corner at this coordinate.

constant.Name: UPDATEBAR_FRAME_SEQU
constant.Comment: The sequence in which the frames should be animated in this incremental updating gauge.

constant.Name: UPDATEBAR_IMAGE_BG
constant.Comment: The image to be used for the background body of the incremental updating gauge, without any animation related images.

constant.Name: UPDATEBAR_IMAGE_FRAME
constant.Comment: All the images (frames), total UPDATEBAR_NUM_FRAMES images, that contribute to the animation of this incremental updating gauge.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_BUTTON_ALIGN_X
constant.Comment: The alignment property of a button around its anchor point. Its a sequence of SOFTBTN_NUM_BUTTONS integer numbers. Valid values for this property would be Graphics.LEFT, Graphics.RIGHT, or Graphics.HCENTER. This value will be combined with Graphics.TOP to orient the label around the anchor.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_BUTTON_MAX_WIDTH
constant.Comment: The maximum width (in pixels) to allow for a button. Its a sequence of SOFTBTN_NUM_BUTTONS integer numbers.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_BUTTON_ANCHOR_X
constant.Comment: The x-coordinate for the anchor point of a button. Its a sequence of SOFTBTN_NUM_BUTTONS integer numbers.

constant.Name: SOFTBTN_BUTTON_ANCHOR_Y
constant.Comment: The y-coordinate for the anchor point of a button. Its a sequence of SOFTBTN_NUM_BUTTONS integer numbers.

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_MON_HE_BG
constant.Comment: The background image for the drop-down month selector if microedition.locale is set to a country where RTL text orientation is used

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_DAY_HE_BG
constant.Comment: The background image for the drop-down day selector if microedition.locale is set to a country where uses RIGHT-TO-LEFT note (Hebrew)

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_YR_HE_BG
constant.Comment: The background image for the drop-down year selector if microedition.locale is set to a country where uses RIGHT-TO-LEFT note (Hebrew)

constant.Name: DATEEDITOR_IMAGE_TIME_HE_BG
constant.Comment: The background image for the drop-down time selector if microedition.locale is set to a country where uses RIGHT-TO-LEFT note (Hebrew)

property.Comment: Timeout in milliseconds to destroy a running MIDlet
Timeout in milliseconds for MIDlets to complete pauseApp() execution within java stack pause

Time in milliseconds for minimal duration of java suspension. It is required to let a user see alert of java suspending. If the time is too short, the alert will not be not shown possibly. If set to 0 the alert will not be shown definitely.
